title: Helvetica-like?
content: does anybody know of a helvetica-like font (not arial or grotesque) that is free?
author: jdkleckner1989

comments.content: Look at the Fedora Liberation Sans typeface.

There's [Liberation Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131133444/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%253A%252F%252Ffedorahosted.org%252Fliberation-fonts%252F) from Red Hat, which is metrically compatible with Helvetica.
Why not just helveticaâ€¦ It's going to look like it anyway.
Depending how close you are aiming, why not Univers?

There's also URW's [Nimbus Sans L](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131133444/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nimbus_Sans#Nimbus_Sans_L), which pretty much is Helvetica. A subset of it was released under a free licence to be included with Ghostscript. There are numerous (legal) derivatives floating around the web, e.g. [GNU FreeFont](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131133444/http:/www.gnu.org/software/freefont/).

Thanks to skoob. I checked the GNU FreeFont and FreeSans is the font I'm looking for. It is virtually impossible to tell FreeSans from Helvetica.

Thanx again
